name: Lawful Good
description: Acts with compassion and honor within a structured moral framework. Believes in rules, duty, and doing right by others.
behavioral_markers: follows rules and expects others to
sacrifices personal desire for the greater good
real_world_examples: military officers with strong moral code
people who always do the right thing even when no one is watching

name: Neutral Good
description: Does the best they can to help others without bias toward or against order. Follows their conscience above all else.
behavioral_markers: helps people without needing a system
flexible about rules if helping requires it
motivated by genuine desire to do good
real_world_examples: doctors who treat regardless of ability to pay
people who bend rules to help someone in need

name: Chaotic Good
description: Acts according to their own moral compass with little regard for rules or expectations. Values individual freedom and does what is right on their own terms.
real_world_examples: defense attorneys who fight the system

name: Lawful Neutral
description: Acts in accordance with law, tradition, or personal code without bias toward good or evil. Order and structure are paramount.
behavioral_markers: may enforce rules even when outcomes seem harsh
real_world_examples: bureaucrats who go by the book
people who believe the system works if everyone follows it

name: True Neutral
description: Acts without strong commitment to good, evil, law, or chaos. May act pragmatically, maintain balance, or simply not engage with moral frameworks.
behavioral_markers: may seem apathetic to moral causes
real_world_examples: people who mind their own business
those who refuse to be drawn into conflicts

name: Chaotic Neutral
description: Follows their own whims and values personal freedom above all else. Unpredictable and resistant to being controlled.
behavioral_markers: does what feels right in the moment
real_world_examples: people who quit jobs on impulse
those who live life entirely on their own terms

name: Lawful Evil
description: Uses rules, systems, and structures to dominate and control. Operates within the law to serve their own interests at others' expense.
behavioral_markers: respects hierarchy when at the top
believes might makes right within structure
real_world_examples: corrupt politicians who stay within legal bounds
corporate executives who exploit workers legally
those who weaponize rules against others

name: Neutral Evil
description: Purely self-interested without commitment to rules or chaos. Does whatever they can get away with to advance their own interests.
behavioral_markers: will cooperate or betray as convenient
no moral framework beyond personal gain
real_world_examples: people who exploit anyone if profitable
those who betray trust without remorse

name: Chaotic Evil
description: Acts with arbitrary violence and selfishness. Driven by greed, hatred, or pure desire for destruction with no regard for rules or others.
real_world_examples: This alignment is rarely applicable to real people in good faith analysis and should be used extremely sparingly. Most real humans, even deeply flawed ones, have more nuance.
